p: Studies using mouse and hamster models have helped to elucidate how flaviviruses that may enter into the CNS; however, the pathways used by these neurotropic flaviviruses remain to be elucidated. Petersen et al. [33] reviewed some of the potential pathways for WNV entry into the CNS, including direct infection of the vascular endothelium; viral passage through the vascular endothelium due to disruption of blood–brain barrier integrity by vasoactive cytokines; and a Trojan horse mechanism, whereby infected monocytes are trafficked into the CNS.
